chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Your Response:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

Your Response:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
q: nat
l: nat
Hl: 0 < l
Hlq: l + 1 < q
Hq: 1 <= q
Hq': 0 < 4 * q
r: nat

Goal:
4 <= r

Premises:
bezout_rel_prime_lt : forall p q : nat, 0 < p < q -> is_gcd p q 1 -> {a : nat & {b : nat | a * p + b * q = 1 + p * q /\ a <= q /\ b <= p}}
bezout_generalized_lt : forall p q : nat, 0 < p < q -> {a : nat & {b : nat & {g : nat & {l : nat & {u : nat & {v : nat | a * p + b * q = g + l /\ is_gcd p q g /\ is_lcm p q l /\ p = u * g /\ q = v * g /\ a <= v /\ b <= u}}}}}}
equation_inj : forall x y a b : nat, 1 <= x -> 1 + x * a = y -> 1 + x * b = y -> a = b
power_mono_l : forall p q x : nat, 1 <= x -> p <= q -> power p x <= power q x
bezout_sc : forall p q a b m : nat, a * p + b * q = 1 + m -> divides p m \/ divides q m -> is_gcd p q 1
power_ge_1 : forall k p : nat, p <> 0 -> 1 <= power k p
natr_ring_lemma1 : forall (n : nat) (l : list nat) (lpe : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr BinNums.N * Ring_polynom.PExpr BinNums.N)) (pe1 pe2 : Ring_polynom.PExpr BinNums.N), Ring_polynom.interp_PElist 0 1 Init.Nat.add Init.Nat.mul (SRsub Init.Nat.add) (SRopp (R:=nat)) eq BinNat.N.to_nat id_phi_N (pow_N 1 Init.Nat.mul) l lpe -> (let lmp := Ring_polynom.mk_monpol_list BinNums.N0 (BinNums.Npos BinNums.xH) BinNat.N.add BinNat.N.mul BinNat.N.add (fun x : BinNums.N => x) BinNat.N.eqb BinNat.N.div_eucl lpe in Ring_polynom.Peq BinNat.N.eqb (Ring_polynom.norm_subst BinNums.N0 (BinNums.Npos BinNums.xH) BinNat.N.add Bin...
Nat.square_lt_simpl_nonneg : forall n m : nat, 0 <= m -> n * n < m * m -> n < m
euclid_2 : forall n : nat, exists q : nat, n = 2 * q \/ n = 1 + 2 * q
Nat.sqrt_up_unique : forall a b : nat, 0 < b -> Nat.pred b * Nat.pred b < a <= b * b -> Nat.sqrt_up a = b
sum_power_binary_lt : forall q : nat, 0 < q -> forall r : nat, r = power q 2 -> forall (p n : nat) (f a : nat -> nat), 0 < p <= q -> (forall i j : nat, i < j < n -> f i < f j) -> (forall i : nat, i < n -> a i < power p 2) -> ∑ n (fun i : nat => a i * power (f i) r) ≲ (power p 2 - 1) * ∑ n (fun i : nat => power (f i) r)
utils_nat.pow2_fix0 = eq_refl : utils_nat.pow2 0 = 1
sum_power_binary_lt_inv : forall q : nat, 0 < q -> forall r : nat, r = power q 2 -> forall (p n : nat) (f e : nat -> nat) (m : nat), 0 < p <= q -> (forall i j : nat, i < j < n -> f i < f j) -> (forall i j : nat, i < j < n -> e i < e j) -> m ≲ (power p 2 - 1) * ∑ n (fun i : nat => power (f i) r) -> exists a : nat -> nat, m = ∑ n (fun i : nat => a i * power (f i) r) /\ (forall i : nat, i < n -> a i < power p 2)
Nat.log2_iter_spec : forall k p q r : nat, 2 ^ S p = q + S r -> r < 2 ^ p -> let s := Nat.log2_iter k p q r in 2 ^ s <= k + q < 2 ^ S s
power_smono_l : forall p q x : nat, 2 <= x -> p < q -> power p x < power q x
nat_meet_powers_neq : forall q : nat, 0 < q -> forall r : nat, r = power q 2 -> forall i j a b : nat, i <> j -> a < r -> b < r -> a * power i r ⇣ (b * power j r) = 0
power_decomp.power_decomp_factor : forall p : nat, 2 <= p -> forall (n : nat) (f a : nat -> nat), (forall i : nat, 0 < i < S n -> f 0 < f i) -> ∑ (S n) (fun i : nat => a i * power (f i) p) = ∑ n (fun i : nat => a (S i) * power (f (S i) - f 0 - 1) p) * power (S (f 0)) p + a 0 * power (f 0) p
power_decomp_factor : forall p : nat, 2 <= p -> forall (n : nat) (f a : nat -> nat), (forall i : nat, 0 < i < S n -> f 0 < f i) -> ∑ (S n) (fun i : nat => a i * power (f i) p) = ∑ n (fun i : nat => a (S i) * power (f (S i) - f 0 - 1) p) * power (S (f 0)) p + a 0 * power (f 0) p
power_0 : forall x : nat, power 0 x = 1
prime = fun p : nat => p <> 1 /\ (forall q : nat, divides q p -> q = 1 \/ q = p) : nat -> Prop Arguments prime _%nat_scope
power_2_minus_1_gt : forall n x : nat, x < power n 2 < -> x ≲ power n 2 - 1
plus_lt_compat : forall n m p q : nat, n < m -> p < q -> n + p < m + q
nat_meet_euclid_power_2 : forall q r1 d1 r2 d2 : nat, r1 < power q 2 -> r2 < power q 2 -> (r1 + d1 * power q 2) ⇣ (r2 + d2 * power q 2) = r1 ⇣ r2 + d1 ⇣ d2 * power q 2
euclid : forall n d : nat, d <> 0 -> {q : nat & {r : nat | n = q * d + r /\ r < d}}
sum_powers_binary_le_inv : forall q : nat, 0 < q -> forall r : nat, r = power q 2 -> forall (n : nat) (f e : nat -> nat) (m : nat), (forall i : nat, i < n -> f i < r) -> (forall i j : nat, i < j < n -> e i < e j) -> m ≲ ∑ n (fun i : nat => f i * power (e i) r) -> {k : nat & {g : nat -> nat & {h : nat -> nat | m = ∑ k (fun i : nat => g i * power (e (h i)) r) /\ k <= n /\ (forall i : nat, i < k -> g i <> 0 /\ g i ≲ f (h i)) /\ (forall i : nat, i < k -> h i < n) /\ (forall i j : nat, i < j < k -> h i < h j)}}}
is_lcm_moduplus : forall k p q g l u : nat, p = u * g -> is_gcd p q g -> is_lcm p q l -> is_lcm p (q + k * p) (l + k * u * p)
le_lt_dec : forall n m : nat, {n <= m} + {m < n}
Nat.mul_lt_mono_pos_r : forall p n m : nat, 0 < p -> n < m < -> n * p < m * p
plus_le_compat : forall n m p q : nat, n <= m -> p <= q -> n + p <= m + q
div_rem_uniq : forall p n1 r1 n2 r2 : nat, p <> 0 -> n1 * p + r1 = n2 * p + r2 -> r1 < p -> r2 < p -> n1 = n2 /\ r1 = r2

```coq
```coq
unfold not. intro. apply Hq'. apply power_mono_l with (1:=Hq).
apply power_smono_l with (x:=4). omega.
Qed.
